issues.description: Return type mismatch for Farm.singFarmSong(): The problem statement (UML and explicit instructions) and the template define singFarmSong() as a void method that prints the song (side-effects to System.out). The solution, however, implements singFarmSong() as public String singFarmSong() that returns the entire song text instead of printing it. This contradicts the specified signature and behavior and may confuse students about whether the method should print or return the song; it can also break tests or the expected usage shown in Main (which expects a void method that prints).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's Farm.singFarmSong() match the specification and template: change its signature to public void singFarmSong() and have it perform printing (System.out.println) for each verse. Alternatively, if returning the song text was intentional, update the problem statement and the template to document/expect a String-returning method and adapt Main and tests accordingly. Preferably, align the solution to the UML/instructions so students and tests are consistent.

issues.description: Return type mismatch for the helper singFarmSongVerse(Animal): The UML and template define singFarmSongVerse(animal: Animal) as a private void helper that prints a verse. The solution implements a private String singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) that returns the verse text. This internal signature/behavior mismatch (returning text instead of printing) conflicts with the UML/template expectation and contributes to the higher-level singFarmSong() mismatch; it may confuse students inspecting the reference solution about whether the helper should print or return verse text.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution helper with the specification: change singFarmSongVerse(Animal) to a private void method that prints the verse (using System.out.println) instead of returning a String. If the intention was to build and return the verse, update the UML and template to reflect a String-returning helper and document that singFarmSong() should print the returned strings — but the clearer fix is to make the solution print directly to match the problem statement.
